notes.note: Prerequisite: EAS 1310 and EAS 1330.
Prerequisite: one semester of college calculus.

course.subject: EAS
course.course_title: Evolution of the Earth and Life

notes.note: Prerequisites: MATH 1110 or MATH 1910.
Prerequisite: Basic college math.
Enrollment limited to: undergraduate students in the Atmospheric Science major or those with permission of the instructor.

Enrollment limited to: students enrolled in the Cornell University Earth and Environmental Systems Field Program in Hawaii. Taught in Hawaii. Prerequisite: EAS 2200, EAS 3030, and one semester each of college level chemistry and calculus, or permission of instructor.
Prerequisite: a course in physics.

course.subject: EAS
course.course_title: Field Study of the Earth System

notes.note: Enrollment limited to: students enrolled in the Cornell University Earth and Environmental Systems Field Program in Hawaii. Taught in Hawaii. Prerequisite: one semester of calculus (MATH 1110 or MATH 1910) and two semesters of any of the following: CHEM 2070/CHEM 2080 or CHEM 2090/CHEM 2080; PHYS 1112/PHYS 2213 or PHYS 2207/PHYS 2208; or equivalent course work.
Prerequisite: Familiarity with multivariate calculus (MATH 2930, MATH 2130, or MATH 2220 or equivalent); one semester of university physics.

Enrollment limited to: students enrolled in the Cornell University Earth and Environmental Systems Field Program in Hawaii. Taught in Hawaii. Prerequisites: two majors-level biology courses or permission of instructor.
Prerequisite: EAS 3410; Co-requisite: EAS 3420.
Prerequisite: EAS 4530 or permission of instructor.
Prerequisite: EAS 3520 and 4510.
Prerequisite: two majors-level biology courses and either BIOEE 2740, BIOSM 3730, EAS 3010, or permission of instructor.
The lab will be held at the Museum of the Earth. Transportation will be provided.

course.subject: EAS
course.course_title: Understanding Tropical Meteorology on Hourly to Interannual Timescales

notes.note: Prerequisite: climate dynamics (equivalent to EAS 3050 or permission of instructor), multivariate calculus (e.g. MATH 2130, MATH 2220, or MATH 2930), and one semester of university physics. Atmospheric thermodynamics (EAS 3410) and atmospheric dynamics (EAS 3420) are recommended, although the latter may be taken concurrently.
Prerequisite: PHYS 2208 or 2213 or equivalent, or permission of instructor.
Prerequisite: MATH 1120 or MATH 1920, and PHYS 2208 or PHYS 2213.
Enrollment limited to: students enrolled in the Cornell University Earth and Environmental Systems Field Program in Hawaii. Taught in Hawaii.

course.subject: EAS
course.course_title: Understanding Tropical Meteorology on Hourly to Interannual Timescales

notes.note: Prerequisite: climate dynamics (equivalent to EAS 3050 or permission of instructor), multivariate calculus (e.g. MATH 2130, MATH 2220, or MATH 2930), and one semester of university physics. Atmospheric thermodynamics (EAS 3410) and atmospheric dynamics (EAS 3420) are recommended, although the latter may be taken concurrently.
